UniLaunch
===
[![LICENSE](https://img.shields.io/github/license/timo-reymann/UniLaunch)](https://github.com/timo-reymann/UniLaunch/blob/main/LICENSE)
[![CircleCI](https://circleci.com/gh/timo-reymann/UniLaunch.svg?style=shield)](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/timo-reymann/UniLaunch)
[![GitHub Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/tag/timo-reymann/UniLaunch?label=version)](https://github.com/timo-reymann/UniLaunch/releases)
[![Renovate](https://img.shields.io/badge/renovate-enabled-green?logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://renovatebot.com)

<p align="center">
	<img width="300" src="./Resources/logo-512.png">
    <br />
    Advanced universal autostart tool for use on Liux, MacOS and Windows.
</p>

## Features

- Support for all major platforms
- Multiple configuration file formats available
- Customizable autostart functionality
- Reusable rule sets
- dotfile-compatible configuration file location

## Requirements

- Windows, MacOS or Linux

## Installation

I provide multiple installation options for each platform, see the list below:

| OS           | CPU Architecture | Type          | Download                |
|:-------------|:-----------------|:--------------|:------------------------|
| Linux        | x64              | executable    | UniLaunch-linux-x64     |
| Linux        | x64              | App-Image     | UniLaunch-x64.AppImage  |
| Linux        | ARM x64          | executable    | UniLaunch-linux amd64   |
| Debian-based | x64              | deb-Package   | UniLaunch-amd64.deb     |
| Debian-based | arm64            | deb-Package   | UniLaunch-arm64.deb     |
| Apple        | x64 / Intel Mac  | dmg-Installer | UniLaunch-x64.dmg       |
| Apple        | arm64 / Silicon  | dmg-Installer | UniLaunch-Silicon.dmg   |
| Windows      | x64              | exe           | UniLaunch-win-x64.exe   |
| Windows      | x64              | Setup         | UniLaunch-Setup.exe     |
| Windows      | ARM x64          | exe           | UniLaunch-win-amr64.exe |

> For MacOS allow apps from unidentified developers or run sudo xattr -r -d com.apple.quarantine /Applications/UniLaunch.app
> after install.

## Usage

### Configuration

Depending on your platform there are different configuration locations searched.

#### Windows

1. `%LOCALAPPDATA%`\UniLaunch\config.yaml
2. `%LOCALAPPDATA%`\UniLaunch\config.json

#### Linux

1. `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME`/UniLaunch/config.yaml
2. `$HOME`/.config/UniLaunch/config.yaml
3. `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME`/UniLaunch/config.json
4. `$HOME`/.config/UniLaunch/config.json
5. /etc/default/UniLaunch

#### MaCOS

1. `$HOME`/Library/Application Support/UniLaunch/config.yaml
2. `$HOME`/.config/uniLaunch.yaml
3. `$HOME`/.config/uniLaunch.macos.yaml
4. `$HOME`/Library/Application Support/UniLaunch/config.json
5. `$HOME`/.config/uniLaunch.json
6. `$HOME`/.config/uniLaunch.macos.json

## Motivation

I use my devices very differently based on the time I start time. While for work I need other programs than for gaming
sessions. Starting these up every day in the same rhythm is annoying and costs unnecessary time.

As I imagine other users have the same problem I decided to build this wonderful project as Open Source.

## Contributing

I love your input! I want to make contributing to this project as easy and transparent as possible, whether it's:

- Reporting a bug
- Discussing the current state of the configuration
- Submitting a fix
- Proposing new features
- Becoming a maintainer

To get started please read the [Contribution Guidelines](./CONTRIBUTING.md).

## Development

### Requirements

#### General

- [.NET Core SDK 8.x](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/8.0)
- [make](https://www.gnu.org/software/make/)

#### Linux

- [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/)

#### Windows

- [InnoSetup](https://jrsoftware.org/isdl.php)

#### MacOS

- [create-dmg](https://github.com/create-dmg/create-dmg)

### Test

````sh
make test
````

### Build

To get the best experience, you should run the builds on each platform respectively.

```sh
make {linux|windows|macos}-build
```

### Alternatives

- Manual autostart and scripts for each platform (script-based; etc.)
